Speaker: eep
Dialogue: We've been in that cave forever.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Eep would you come down here? You're being so dramatic.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No, I mean, you're already out now.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Never mind, Thunk. Just, come out.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Uhh, but if you don't give the signal, how do I know you're my dad?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: The signal isn't so you know it's me, it's so you know I wasn't eaten by an animal.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Then why is the signal an animal noise? I mean, doesn't that just confuse things?

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Mom, we're ready to leave.  Mom!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Get um Mom! Do it for the Croods!

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Old lady down! Eep, avenge me.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Oh hey Dad, can we eat now?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Just wait till we get home. Eep put on the brakes.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Here you go, Thunk. Drink up.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: That's alright. I ate last week.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Come on Croods. Go, go, go.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Come on, come on. Darkness brings death! We know this.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: The moon is full. Bath night.  You too, Mom.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: You know she hates the cave, Grug.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: How can she not like the cave? It's so cozy.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: It is a little, dark, Grug.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: I was watching. I was fine.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: What were you doing up there, Eep?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Well then why did you go up there?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: I don't know. GRUG Why don't you know? Stop looking for things. Fear keeps us alive Eep. Never not be afraid.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: What's the point of all this?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: I mean, why are we here? What are we doing this for?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No one said survival was fun.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Hmm? Would you come down here. Eep?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I just don't see why she needs her own ledge. That's all. That's what this is about.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: She's working through some things and needs her own space.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: What things? How long is this going to take? Really? I mean she already doesn't listen to me.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: If she wants to survive, she has to follow our rules.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: How about a story? Eep loves those.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: That's a good idea ... How about a story, huh?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Oh yeah, tell us a story.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Ok. Can I borrow that? Thank you. Eep! Your old favorite?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: I haven't played with that thing in years.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Tonight we'll hear the story of Krispy Bear.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Yes. And one day, while she was in a tree, the curious little bear wanted to climb to the top.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: And no sooner than she climbed to the top, she saw something new and died.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Yes! Her last moments of terror still frozen on her face.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: I get it, dad. I get it. I will never do anything new or different.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Quiet! I'm not supposed to be out here.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: No! It's mine. No, no. I caught it!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's dying. I can fix it!

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: It does what you tell it?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's not alive. EEP But you said it was dying.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: It comes from where you come from?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Ow. Okay, it doesn't come out of me.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Are you dead? Can I have your fire if you're dead?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: And this is Belt. Cook, conversationalist, navigator, also keeps my pants up.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Let me clarify, Eep. The world is ending.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I've seen it. It's coming this way. First, the Earth is going to shake. Then it breaks open. Everything falls in. Fire. Lava. I don't mean to sound too dramatic, but Aaaaaaaugh. Believe me, everything we're standing on, all this right here, will be gone.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Okay. Here. If you survive, call me.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Are you hurt? What took you?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Nothing. I left on my own.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: You... youuuuuuu... ww-what!? EEP Dad, let me explain...

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: You know what, I am so mad right now, that I can't talk to her.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: You'll never believe it. I found something new.

Speaker: croods
Dialogue: New?!!!! The Croods all SNATCH up stones. They form a defensive circle.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Eep. Stay inside the family kill circle.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Oh. Well, I thought he was a warthog, but then he turned into a boy.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Eep's got a boy hog! Eep's got a boy hog!

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: There was a boy. Watch, okay. I'm gonna call him.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: It was beautiful. You want to see dangerous? Here.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Okay Eep, that's it. We're going back to the cave and you're going to stay in there until you're older than... her!

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: What!? You can't keep me inside forever!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Yes. Grug, the cave, it's gone.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: You really need to see this...

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No. No one is going anywhere.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: One, two, three, four, five -- BEAT. Grug smiles.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I don't know, I'm not sure. Down. In a lower place. One thing's for sure, we can't go back the way we came.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: If it was me, I'm just throwing this out there, if it was me choosing the cave, I would go with a smaller cave.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Alright dad, go get `em! Oh, oh, now you got em-- Now they're really hitting you. Dad I got it, just stop running into their fists.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Grug, when you're done, we should get going.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: That's right! You can't get past this!

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Hey look! This cave has a tongue. Awesome!

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Okay, that's one, two, three, four, five... six...

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: And seven... if we're counting Chunky the Death Cat.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Hah! It's scared of the dark... wait... we're scared of the dark.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Cavemen! Stand back! They're practically animals. See their bony, sloping foreheads?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: The excessive body hair? Oh, that one's got a tail...

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Ah, the sun is in his hands!

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: It doesn't come out of him.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You know, you're a lot like your daughter.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Whoa! Stay back. We don't know what it wants.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Sandy! No! Fire is not a play thing!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Aww, what a cute little guy.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Thunk! Uh, try hiding from it in the tall dry grass!

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Stop please, please. I'm only nine.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: So, your Dad, he's trying to kill me. EEP Yeah. But I won't let him.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: They're not so scary once you get to know them.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. We're the Croooooods! And you are?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Wow! Looks like magic. And smells like food.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: The mountain? High ground? End of the world, remember?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: That already happened. It destroyed our cave.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Noooo. That was just the beginning of the end. The end of the end is still coming.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: We can't let him go! What if we don't find a cave before sunset? What if it takes a few days? What if the birds come back?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Fine. You're staying with us till we find a cave.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What? No I'm not. Don't make me part of this. Stay here if you want, but let me go. I've got a dream, a mission, a reason to live.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Umm... I've got an idea. Let's go to that mountain.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Dad really has his heart set on a cave.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Uh, there, are, caves on that mountain.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's a mountain. Mountains are safe. Mountains have caves. And water. And sticks.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Mom? Did you hear that? I can get my own stick!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Yes. Sticks. Caves and sticks. Crazy sticks. Let's go.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: No no, it's okay Sandy. That's just a belt.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I've made a decision. We're going to, that mountain! Don't ask me why. It's just a hunch. It just feels right.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: I don't know Grug. We've never really walked that far.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: I don't think my feet can do that.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: I'll never live long enough to get there.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: We'll become closer as a family.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Aaaaaaaaugh. Get her off. Get off.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: If you're not ready to challenge her, then don't look her in the eye.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Could you keep your big giant arms on your side of the trail!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: No more touching. No more touching.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Isn't this fun? We're taking our first trip together.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Do you want me to turn this family around? Do you?! Because I will turn this family around so fast!

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Come on, you can hold it.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Go behind one of those lumpy things and make it fast.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Maybe we should have stopped for water.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Dad, can I take a turn carrying him?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I can do this all day long. No, no, no, and still no.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: I'm not dying on an empty stomach.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: I'm pretty dizzy, so I'm just going to lay down for a minute.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: We'll eat when we get there.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: It's taking too long! I'm grabbing a snack.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: No. No. No. Don't do that. He will cut you. That's not food, he's a pet. My pet.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: What's a pet? GUY An animal that you don't eat.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No man should have a pet. It's weird, and wrong. It's--  ...It's food!

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Angry girl wants to be doing what they're doing.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Get it off! You stay away from me.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: No seriously, what are they doing?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: You've got a ton of eggs. Just make another egg!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: What happened to the egg and the bird?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: You know, we lost him. But when the bird stepped on me and pushed me into the ground, the scorpion grabbed a hold of me and one thing led to another and here we are eating him. Win win.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Not enough. Not enough. I need more. I need more!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Oh, look at that. She's not gonna eat me right?

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: You're too skinny. If she was gonna eat anyone it would be--

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Hold her still. Use a rock. Ugga would you just hit her legs.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Owww! I just want something to eat.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: You have bug for dinner. Plenty of bug!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Please... I'll let you help me hunt.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Ahhh! They're all over me... Tell my story...

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Okay. Guy carefully SETS the trigger.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: soft whistle Raargh, Thump thump thump, thubububububub soft whistle poom! Tadaaaaaa!

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: How long have you been alone?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Just move your arm... no, your other arm. Oh, that one's mine.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Looks like we won't be having any leftovers.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You know, when you have so much food to eat you have some, left over.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: We never have that much food.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: That's a good idea. How about a story huh?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Yeah a story, tell us a story!

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Once upon a time there was a little tiger who lived in a cave with her family. There were a lot of rules, but the big, simple one was to never leave the cave at night. And the door was so heavy, you'd think it would be easy to remember.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I know! But, while everyone was asleep, she went out anyway.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Yes! And no sooner than she did, her cave was destroyed and everyone had to go on this long, sucky walk, with some weirdo they met, and died! The end.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Whoa! I did not see that coming. Twist ending. My stories never end like that.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Yes! Two stories in one night!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Okay. But it won't be as good as Grug's. Um, once upon a time, there was a beautiful tiger. She lived in a cave with the rest of her family. Her father and mother told her, "You may go anywhere you want but never go near the cliff, for you could fall."

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: But when no one was looking, she would go near the cliff, for the closer she came to the edge, the more she could hear, the more she could see, the more she could feel. Finally, she stood at the very edge, and she saw a light. She leaned out to touch it, and slipped.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: A place with more suns in the sky than you can count.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: A place not like today, or yesterday, a place where things are better.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Tomorrow isn't a place, you can't see it!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Oh yes, yes it is. I've seen it. That's where I'm going.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Well, WE are going to shut our eyes and sleep. And when we wake up we're going to find the place that has everything we want.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: That was too close. It almost caught us.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I was watching. We were fine.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: We've got to move faster. Do you people have any other speed aside from "wander?" I'll take a shamble at this point.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Hey, do you have a minute? How did the tiger fly?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I only share when I'm outside the log. I'm funny that way.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: You mean these rocks? Ahh owww! Do not step on these rocks!

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Well, there goes our chance for survival.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Ow! Jumping doesn't help, I mean, just briefly, but it doesn't get better! Ow! Do not walk on your hands, the hands do not help at all.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I can help you, but we're going to have to make a few changes around here. The log ride is over. Drop the log.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhh! I love them! Where are my feet!? GUY They're still there!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Okay! She's up. I'm good. We're good...

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: These shoes are great! Where do you get these ideas?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Dad. I don't have a brain.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: We've gotten along just fine without brains till now. Cavemen don't need brains. We have these. Heeya! Haha!  That's what I'm talking about! Ideas are for weaklings. Grug punches at the air in front of Guy making him wince.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Good fish. Don't eat my feet.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: He jumped on the sun and rode it to tomorrow.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No, no, no! The family moves across, Grug is the last to follow.

Speaker: belt
Dialogue: Hmmmmm. Belt makes an Origami boat. He and Sandy sail across the rain puddles.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Oh dad, you say that about everything.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Augh! No no no! Not cool. Not cool. Not cool.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: So the bear says, "Your cave?" I've been dumping my bones here since last week.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Last week, haha. That's a funny story!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's not a story! It's a joke.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: You know, just making something up... to make you laugh.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Here you go, one for you, and this ones for you.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Okay. Okay. That's enough. I don't see why the kids need their own shells.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: So if anyone gets in trouble, we can call the others.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Wait-- you're saying we should split up?

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: We can try more paths at once. It's the fastest way through.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No no no no no. It's my job to keep you safe. I'm still in charge and we are not splitting up.  Except for you two. And that's final.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Dad? I'm freaking out a little bit. Just tell me what to do. Just what do I do right now?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Stay where you are. I'll find you.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: No. Too slow. Everybody, keep moving forward and we'll get out.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: It's gonna be okay. I'm gonna pass out.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Good boy. Whose my good boy? You need a name, you want a name? I'm going to call you - Douglas. Look at him. Can you do tricks? Roll over. Come on Douglas, roll over.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: I was in love once. He was a hunter, I was a gatherer. It was quite a scandal. We fed each other berries. We danced.  Then my father smashed him with a rock and traded me to your Grandfather.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Grug, they're okay. Guy's with them.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Oh, oh, `Guy'. `Guy' is with them. Well thank you for bringing me that interesting Guy update!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Oh, okay. I'm gonna go up and why don't you join us when you stop being a big drag!

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Sleep pile? How about a story, huh? Anyone?

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: And then Torg said "Know it? I drew it!"

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: I know it was hard for you to bring us along, but they had the best day of their lives... Thank you for that.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I want to show you something.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: More suns in the sky than you can count.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Every sun that crosses our sky, comes to rest up there.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Well, that makes one of us. Count me in!

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Grug has no idea how to protect us. In fact, he has no ideas at all.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: No, that's not true. What about that one time when he a...

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: Face it! If he actually had an idea of his own I'd, I'd have a heart attack and die!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: He's a big guy. How can he just disappear like that?

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Hey wait. Let's ask that ugly lady if she's seen dad.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Yeah, Wow. Like, I was up all night cuz like all these, ideas just kept coming to me.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Belt! New and improved! It's even self- tightening. Ow!

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: What is that on your head?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I call it a "rug." Rhymes with Grug. And this one. I call it a "ride." Rhymes with Grug.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: It's gonna get us places faster than shoes.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: I wish I had a ride.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Painting is a thing of the past. I call this, a "snap-shot."

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Let's do it again. I think I blinked.

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: The sun doesn't hurt my eyes anymore! Where do you get these great ideas?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Since I don't have a brain, they're coming from my stomach. Down deep below, and then up again into my mind.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Grug. We have to keep moving.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: See, I got ideas, I got thoughts.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: I almost feel sorry for him.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: What are you trying to do Grug?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I thought if I could have ideas like Guy, maybe Eep would listen to me. Maybe she wouldn't want to go with Guy.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Oh Grug, is that what this is all about?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Cave! Everyone inside. Come on! Hurry up, let's go. Go, go.

Speaker: gran
Dialogue: We're gonna jump on the sun and ride it to Tomorrow with Guy.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Wait, so you're all going to do this?

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: You have to stop worrying for all of us. GRUG It's my job to worry. It's my job to follow the rules.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: The rules don't work out here.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: That wasn't living, that was just, not dying. There's a difference.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Ugga, everyone, you have to listen to me.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: We would be dead if we listened you.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: This is pointless. We're running out of time. Everything is collapsing. You're being irrational and counterproductive.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Big words anger me. Keep talking.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Hnnnnnngh! No. What is this stuff that saves you from my punches?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No. I have to get back to them.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: I was little when it happened. The last thing my parents told me was, "Don't hide. Live. Follow the Sun. You'll make it to Tomorrow."

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: You followed the light. My daughter is a lot like you.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: No. She's like you. She loves you but always forgets to say it. Just like you forget to tell her.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I guess I was just busy keeping them all alive.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: It's okay. That's what Dads do.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Yeah, I know. But he's doing the best with what he has. Let's go.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Scared? I'll show you scared. Hand me those acting sticks!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: Hurry! Come on. We're gonna make it!

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: There it is. The sun. We can do it! We can ride it to Tomorrow.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: We have to go back to the cave. Hurry, hurry, stay together. Let's keep moving. Move, move! Everybody hold my hand. Thunk let's go. Go! Let's stay together.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: No more dark. No more hiding. No more caves.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: No. We don't know what's over there. Maybe nothing. It's too risky.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: You know, I've wanted to throw you away ever since I met you.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: He made it... He made it...

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: When you make it, so will I.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: No. I have too much to say to you. I need to fix everything and I don't have time.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: This works good. What do you call it?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: I was thinking of calling it a Hug.  Because it rhymes with Grug. But you can change it if you want.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: They're in trouble. Hang on! I'm coming.

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Run! Grug leaps onto the Macawnivore's back as the birds move in closer. The ground begins to break up violently as lakes empty themselves and entire forests turn sideways.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: I never got to tell him.

Speaker: ugga
Dialogue: Eep, if your Dad were here, he would tell YOU TO--

Speaker: thunk
Dialogue: Wow, you sound just like him.

Speaker: guy
Dialogue: He's riding the Sun... but not very well. Everybody out of the way!

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Ahhh! Where's the danger? Who blew their shell?

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: One, two, three, four, five, six...

Speaker: grug
Dialogue: Well, a boys gotta have a pet.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: You really need to see this.

Speaker: eep
Dialogue: Our world is still plenty harsh and hostile. But now we know the Croods will make it.
